info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 3:20PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 400 PM MST... At 320 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sugarloaf Mountain, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Scottsdale, Apache Junction, Fountain Hills, Sugarloaf Mountain, Granite Reef Dam, McDowell Mountain Park, Usery Mountain Park, Saguaro Lake, Canyon Lake, Goldfield Ranch, Salt River Tubing Recreation Area, Rio Verde and Fort McDowell. This includes AZ Route 87 between mile markers 186 and 209. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
